description:
Continuation of CFMIP-2 AMIP experiments and CMIP5 experiment 6.7c. 
Aquaplanet (no land) experiment with CO2 set to the AMIP mean concentration and no seasonal cycle.  Impose a uniform +4K perturbation to the zonally uniform SSTs of the aquaControl, on a planet without continents but with cloud-radiative effects switched off in the LW radiation code.
keywords: CFMIP, Tier 2, aquaplanet, +4K, zonal SSTs, no sea ice, no longwave cloud-radiative effects
long_name: aquaplanet plus 4K SSTs with longwave cloud radiative effects off
rationale: Understand the role of cloud-radiative effects in the large-scale atmospheric circulation in current and perturbed climates.

requirements.description: Begin in 1979 and run for 10 years after a few months of spin up.
requirements.label: 1979-1988 10yrs

requirements.description: Impose a +4K perturbation to the aquacontrol zonally-uniform distribution of SST.
requirements.label: Zonally Uniform SST +4K

requirements.description: No sea ice at high latitudes.  Sea surface temperature should be set to a spatially uniform 0°C poleward of 60°.
requirements.label: No Sea Ice

requirements.description: Switch off cloud-radiative effects in the long wave part of the radiation code.
requirements.label: LW Cloud Radiation Off

requirements.description: Radiatively active trace gases are well-mixed with mixing ratios following the AMIP II recommendations: CO2: 348 ppmv; CH4: 1650 ppbv; N2O: 306 ppbv; Halocarbon yield of approximately 0.24 W m-2 radiative forcing.
requirements.keywords: Green House Gas, GHG AMIPII, radiatively active trace gas
requirements.label: AMIP II GHG

requirements.description: The ozone distribution is derived from the climatology used in AMIP II (Gates et al., 1999) and is constant in time and symmetric about the equator. This ozone distribution is provided as a netCDF file which is archived on the Earth System Grid and available via the DOI http://dx.doi.org/10.5065/D61834Q6
requirements.label: AMIP II Ozone

requirements.description: Apply perpetual equinoctial conditions (no seasonal forcing).
requirements.keywords: perpetual equinoctial conditions, perpetual equinox, no seasonal forcing.
requirements.label: perpetual Equinox

requirements.description: An Atmosphere only general circulation model configuration.
requirements.label: AGCM Configuration
